hotlines.name: Boys and Girls Aid Society
hotlines.notes: Counseling, adoption services, shelter program for women who are pregnant.

hotlines.name: Bradley-Angle House
hotlines.notes: For women and women with children fleeing domestic violence. 24-hour crisis line. Undisclosed location.

hotlines.name: Clackamas Women's Services
hotlines.notes: Women and women w/children fleeing domestic violence or recent sexual abuse. No males over 18. 24-Hour phone intake.

hotlines.name: Cocaine Anonymous
hotlines.notes: Help line and call center for people struggling with cocaine addiction.

hotlines.name: Disability Rights Oregon
hotlines.notes: Disability issues

hotlines.name: Disability Rights Oregon
hotlines.notes: Providing legal aid.

Support for children ages 4 - 17 who have witnessed or experienced domestic or dating violence; also encouraging adult victims to participate in their children's treatment. Undisclosed location in Hillsboro.

hotlines.name: Fair Housing Council of Oregon Discrimination Hotline
hotlines.notes: Discrimination hotline. Education and enforcement in the area of housing discrimination. Tests to determine discrimination. Files complaints on your behalf.

hotlines.name: Housing Authority of Downtown Portland Public Housing Hotline
hotlines.notes: Public housing rental unit availability and referrals for affordable housing to individuals and families in Multnomah County. All public housing waiting lists are closed because the wait time exceeds a year.

hotlines.name: Housing Connections Internet Search Tool
hotlines.notes: Internet search tool for finding housing in Multnomah, Washington, Clackamas and Clark counties.

hotlines.name: International Refugee Center of Oregon
hotlines.notes: Assistance for refugees in the U.S. for less than 25 years.

hotlines.name: Lawyer Referral Service
hotlines.notes: Referrals to attorneys in the area where callers need assistance.

hotlines.name: LifeWorks Northwest
hotlines.notes: Adult Counseling Services, multiple sites. Options for individuals, couples, and families who seek counseling services in coping with divorce, parenting, depression, domestic violence, and relationships. Culturally specific services available.

hotlines.name: Mental Health Call Center
hotlines.notes: 24-hour, mental health resource and information referral, crisis support and mental health emergency assistance throughout Multnomah County. Mental health assistance and referral through Project Respond.

hotlines.name: Military Helpline
hotlines.notes: Information and referral for military members, veterans and families.

hotlines.name: Multnomah County Crisis Line
hotlines.notes: Mental health concerns, low-cost counseling referrals

hotlines.name: OHP Client Advocate Services Unit
hotlines.notes: For questions about coverage and billing in the Oregon Health Plan.

hotlines.name: Oregon Prescription Drug Program
hotlines.notes: Helps Oregonians purchase prescription drugs at discounted prices. Maintains a list of prescription drugs for the best possible price. View prescriptions online.

hotlines.name: Oregon Safenet
hotlines.notes: Helpline for women, teens and children; statewide referral services for health care, social, and mental health services, pregnancy and reproductive health services.
Connects uninsured and under-insured Oregonians with free or discounted prescriptions through patient assistance programs.

hotlines.name: Poison Control Center
hotlines.notes: Emergency assistance for immediate poisonings.

hotlines.name: Portland Bad Date Line
hotlines.notes: Reporting line for violent or abusive customers in the sex industry. Reports are anonymous and distributed to the industry.

hotlines.name: Raphael House of Portland
hotlines.notes: 24-hour crisis line. Emergency housing for victims fleeing a domestic violence situation. Advocacy includes support groups, children's groups, referrals, and emotional support. 60-day limit.

hotlines.name: Social Security Information
hotlines.notes: For questions about Social Security benefits.

hotlines.name: Veterans Suicide Prevention Hotline
hotlines.notes: National suicide prevention hotline to ensure veterans in emotional crisis have free 24/7 access to trained counselors.

hotlines.name: Volunteers of America Home Free
hotlines.notes: Domestic violence intervention, support groups (children & adults) advocacy and emergency vouchering when available.

hotlines.name: Washington County Crisis Team
hotlines.notes: Call for crisis intervention, support and appropriate referrals.

hotlines.name: Yolanda House
hotlines.notes: An emergency shelter and service program for women survivors of domestic or sexual violence and their children.
